metadata.title: Snooze mode of RX261 and RX260

sections.content:
Question:
What are the benefits of snooze mode of the low power consumption function?
Answer:
Specific peripheral functions can be operated during standby by using snooze mode.
For example, in the case of a battery-powered smart locks with touch keys, it was necessary to wake up from the software standby mode periodically in order to detect finger contact at arbitrary timing and start operation. This series of processes requires power to operate CPU, which is a challenge when optimizing power consumption.
The smart wake-up solution that uses the snooze mode and capacitive touch sensing unit of the RX261 and RX260 contributes to reducing power consumption in applications requiring intermittent operation such as the above.
Suitable Products
RX261, RX260
